title: Equipment Drag and Drop Placement
description: Verify that equipment can be dragged from the toolbar onto the stage canvas and positioned as desired.

steps.description: Navigate to the game level with toolbar and stage canvas.
Drag an equipment item from the toolbar onto the stage canvas.
Confirm the equipment is placed on the stage canvas at dropped location.
Drag the placed equipment to a new position on the stage.
Verify the equipment moves smoothly and updates its position accordingly.
Attempt dragging equipment rapidly or to the edges and corners of the canvas.
Check that the equipment does not go outside visible canvas boundaries and remains draggable.

title: Cable Connection Creation and Validation
description: Test the ability to create cable connections between equipment connectors and validate correctness in real-time.

steps.description: Place two compatible equipment items on the stage.
Click a connector point on the first equipment.
Select appropriate cable type and connect to a compatible connector on the second equipment.
Verify that the connection line appears with correct cable color coding.
Confirm real-time validation feedback indicates the connection is valid and correct.
Attempt making an invalid connection between incompatible connectors.
Check that visual feedback indicates the connection error clearly (color and animation).

title: Equipment Information Popups
description: Ensure users can access detailed equipment information popups via question mark icons.

steps.description: Place equipment on the stage.
Click the question mark icon associated with an equipment item.
Verify a popup appears displaying accurate detailed information about the equipment.
Close the popup.
Confirm the popup closes cleanly without impacting other UI elements.

title: Hints and Help System Accessibility and Accuracy
description: Validate the hints and help system can be accessed via keyboard shortcuts and provides correct guidance.

steps.description: Start a level with incomplete connections.
Use the designated keyboard shortcut to request a general hint.
Check that a general hint appears relevant to the current level progress.
Use the keyboard shortcut to request detailed step-by-step guidance.
Verify detailed hints match level objectives and connection requirements.
Confirm hint requests affect scoring as expected.

title: Level Completion Detection and Victory Celebration
description: Verify the system detects correct completion of all required connections and triggers celebration animations and sounds.

steps.description: Complete all required connections correctly in a level.
Confirm the system detects level completion accurately.
Verify victory celebrations including confetti animations appear promptly.
Ensure victory sound effects play on level completion.
Attempt to trigger the victory celebration with incomplete or improper connections.
Verify that victory animations and sounds do NOT trigger erroneously.

title: Game State Persistence in Local Storage
description: Ensure game state (progress, scores, completed levels) is saved and loaded correctly across user sessions.

steps.description: Start a level and make partial progress including equipment placement and connections.
Close or reload the browser tab/window.
Verify that upon reload, the game restores the saved state accurately to the last progress point.
Complete a level and ensure completion is recorded.
Check that completed level status and scores persist and are reflected in the level selection menu.

title: Keyboard Shortcuts Functionality
description: Validate that all keyboard shortcuts correctly trigger their respective actions such as hints, validation, debugging, and game controls.

steps.description: Press keyboard shortcut for hint.
Confirm hint system activates and shows appropriate hints.
Press keyboard shortcut to trigger validation.
Verify real-time connection validation feedback updates.
Press keyboard shortcut for debug tools.
Check debug output appears in console and highlight overlays show connection issues.
Press game control shortcuts (pause, reset, etc.).
Verify game controls work correctly and UI updates accordingly.

title: Audio Equipment Real-time Testing and Analysis
description: Test audio equipment functionality including real-time sound effects and frequency analysis on supported browsers.

steps.description: Place audio equipment on stage and open audio testing interface.
Use microphone input to test real-time audio frequency analysis.
Verify that audio frequency analysis is displayed correctly in real-time.
Play sound effects using the audio system controls.
Confirm audio playback occurs with expected sound quality and timing.
Test audio features on unsupported browsers or with microphone access denied.
Check appropriate fallback behavior or error messaging without crashing.

title: Responsive Canvas Adaptation
description: Ensure the game stage canvas adapts fluidly to different screen sizes and resolutions without clipping or overflow.

steps.description: Open the game on various screen sizes including desktop, tablet, and mobile resolutions.
Verify the stage canvas resizes appropriately filling available space.
Check that no equipment or UI elements are clipped or cause overflow outside the visible area.
Resize the browser window dynamically.
Confirm canvas and equipment positions adjust responsively without losing functionality.

title: Debug Tools Output and Visual Highlights
description: Verify that debug tools triggered by keyboard shortcuts provide correct console output and visual highlights for connection issues.

steps.description: Press debug tool keyboard shortcut during incomplete or incorrect connection setup.
Check console logs for detailed messages describing connection problems.
Verify problematic connections are visually highlighted on the stage with color coding or animations.
Attempt debug tools with all connections correct.
Confirm debug tool output indicates no errors and no unnecessary highlights.
